result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 147 Days were granted.
**4/9/19:  PER CLARIFICATION REQUEST OF DOC, COURT CORRECTS JOC TO REFLECT THAT THIS SENTENCE IS TO BE CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.  SEE TRANSCRIPT, at page 32.**
Consecutive to: ANY OTHER SENTENCE

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Buy Money to be paid Joint and Several with co-actor.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.

No Contact with co-actor listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Case 16CF1151 was dismissed and read in.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roberto Robles appears by videoconference from Dodge Correctional, in custody.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant filed motion requesting sentence credit.  State objects.  Court denies request based on its calculation of days on the record.
Motion hearing on April 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roberto Robles
Current: P.O. Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 04-10-2017)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Motion for Sentence Credit and for Amended Judgment of Conviction Under Wis. Stat. 973.155 filed by defendant, pro se.
Reviewed by Judge Carter 4/12/17; Set for court hearing, w/notice to parties.
Filed by Court Reporter, Cheryl Humpal - From Plea and Sentencing Held on 02/16/17.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Roberto Robles in court, in custody, with Attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Repeat enhancer is stricken.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Chesshir makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 147 days)
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actor listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


BUY MONEY:  $160.00 to Waukesha Police Dept. (Joint and several with Co-Def) (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA srucharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by the State.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

Attorney Carl William Chesshir in court.   Defendant Roberto Robles did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roberto Robles was supposed to appear by videoconference from Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Carl William Chesshir appears on behalf of Defendant.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  When clerk dialed Jackson Correctional for his appearance, staff informed the court that Defendant was not allowed to appear by videoconference today and was not available.  Attorney Chesshir waives Defendant's appearance for today.  Court adjourns.  Defendant to appear by videoconference from Jackson Correctional.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
